critique: This document establishes an emergency board to investigate a dispute between the Port Authority Trans-Hudson Corporation and the Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen. It is based on the Railway Labor Act. There is no ideological tilt. It does not relate to immigration. It does not expand executive power, as it is based on existing law. It does not relate to federalism. It does not relate to national security or civil liberties. It involves government intervention in economic matters to resolve a labor dispute. It does not relate to social inclusion.
